content.text:
A patient comes in complaining of abdominal pain and the doctor orders an x-ray of the abdomen. Afterwards, you compare it to the last image the patient had taken and you see this x-ray. What is the name of this x-ray position? <image 1>

A. KUB (Kidneys, ureter, and bladder)
B. Lateral Decubitus
C. Upright Abdominal x-ray
D. IVP (Intra venous Pyelogram)

The x-ray position shown in the image is:

C. Upright Abdominal x-ray

This type of x-ray is used to visualize the abdominal organs while the patient is standing or sitting upright, which can help in identifying conditions such as bowel obstructions or free air under the diaphragm.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
